body: Tentatively slated for 5.8 M1 solely for the purpose of _team discussion_.

rename.from: Add an `assertInstanceOf` or `assertExceptionOfType` to standard assertions

body:
An `assertInstanceOf` assertion sounds good, simple, and useful.

@jbee, would you like to provide a PR?

issue.title: assertThrows doesn't fail if the thrown exception is of child type

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: âœ… The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
## Steps to reproduce

`assertThrows(IOException.class, () -> service.readFile("sampleFile.txt")); `

this assertion will pass even if the exception is FileNotFoundException.

I believe this is happening because we are using `Class#isInstance` it will return true for parent types also.

https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/637a78393194737e77d6f9681ad93e9ddac1f399/junit-jupiter-api/src/main/java/org/junit/jupiter/api/AssertThrows.java#L58

Shouldn't this be replaced with `if (expectedType == actualException.getClass())` ?

body:
After discovering that assertion I find it really expressive and useful.
Could you please also add a Kotlin variant of `assertInstanceOf` to _Assertions.kt_? E.g.

Usage:
```
Now:            assertInstanceOf(String::class.java, actual)
Kotlin version: assertInstanceOf<String>(actual)
```

Definition:
```
inline fun <reified T : Any> assertInstanceOf(actualValue: Any?): T =
    Assertions.assertInstanceOf(T::class.java, actualValue)
...
```
@bjmi Sounds like that would be a good addition. Could you please raise a new issue for that or send a PR?

issue.title: Introduce `assertInstanceOf()` for Kotlin

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: âœ… The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
This is a follow up of #2492 but for Kotlin.

After discovering the new `assertInstanceOf` assertion (since 5.8) I find it really expressive and useful.
Could you please also add a Kotlin variant to _Assertions.kt_? E.g.

Usage:

```
Now:      assertInstanceOf(String::class.java, actual)
Proposal: assertInstanceOf<String>(actual)
```

Definition:

```
inline fun <reified T : Any> assertInstanceOf(actualValue: Any?): T =
    Assertions.assertInstanceOf(T::class.java, actualValue)
...
```

issue.title: change assertTrue(a instanceof b) -> assertInstanceOf(a, b)

labels.name: for: backport-to-5.1.x
labels.description: Issues that will be back-ported to the 5.1.x line

repository.name: spring-batch
repository.description: Spring Batch is a framework for writing batch applications using Java and Spring

issue.body:
`assertInstanceOf` has been added since [Junit5(jupiter) version 5.8](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/issues/2492). 
All existing test codes that used `assertTrue (a instanceOf b)` have been changed to simpler codes such as `assertInstanceOf(a, b)`.
